page.title: 09LUX LUX TEXTILES LEEK
page.content: The building was built about 1920 for Davanport Adams who used knitting machines. It now produces high class lingerie mainly nightdresses for Marks and Spencers. It is one big room in which,the laying up of fabric, cutting and distribution of work is put onto special carriers and fed by a rail system to the girls who make the garments up by using a wide variety of sewing machines.It employs about 170 people who make about 2,000 dozen garments per week.I have worked there 20 years and have seen alot of new technology coming on new machinary.
